triples.name: Soil microbiology
triples.relevance: Paper examines soil microbial communities and their network properties in response to land use conversion.

triples.name: Land use
triples.relevance: Land use conversion from native grassland to cropland is the central driver being studied.

triples.name: Microbial ecology
triples.relevance: Study applies microbial ecology principles to understand soil community responses to disturbance.

triples.name: Network complexity
triples.relevance: Paper identifies that land use conversion increases network complexity metrics in microbial communities.

triples.name: Robustness of complex networks
triples.relevance: Paper demonstrates increased network robustness and decreased vulnerability in agricultural systems.

triples.name: Biodiversity
triples.relevance: Paper contrasts reduced microbial biodiversity in cropland with increased network complexity.

triples.name: Grassland
triples.relevance: Native tallgrass prairie serves as baseline ecosystem for comparison with converted agricultural land.

triples.name: Ecological network
triples.relevance: Paper applies molecular ecological network analysis to study species interactions in soil communities.

triples.name: Biological interaction
triples.relevance: Paper studies how agricultural disturbance alters species interactions and network relationships.

triples.name: Ecosystem
triples.relevance: Paper analyzes ecosystem-level processes including network stability and function maintenance under disturbance.
